page.title: 03HISTORY OF NORTH WEST HAWICK
page.content: THERE WAS A SAW MILL AT APPLE TREE HALL AND LOTS OF OTHER BUILDINGS THERE WERE STABLES AT MIDSHEILDS THEY HAVE BEEN KNOCKED DOWN NOW AND THERE WAS A RAILWAY GOING THROUGH MIDSHEILDS IT WAS SHUT DOWN IN 1969 IT HAS BEEN 16 YEARS SINCE THE RAILWAY HAS BEEN CLOSED.IN 1514 THERE WAS A BATTLE AT FLOODEN.THE SCOTTISH CAPTURED THE ENGLISH FLAG AT HORNS HOLE THERE WAS A MAN CALLED LAWSON HE OWNED THE BRIDGE AT THE HAUGH AND HE PROVIDED THE MONEY FOR IT BEEN BUILT HE WAS A TOWN COUNCILLOR AND A JEWLLER IN THE SANDBED FOR MANY YEARS.CAVERS CONTAINS THE BEST HISTORY OF THE AREA. IT BELONGS TO THE DOUGLA'S,ONE OF THE MOST POPULAR FAMILES.THE HOUSE HAS BEEN IN THIER POSESSION SINCE THE 12TH CENTUARY.THE LAST DOUGLASES DIDN'T HAVE ANY MALE CHILDREN BUT THEY HAD A
